title: Unknown x Amplify US 2026 Planning KO
calendar_event_title: Unknown x Amplify US 2026 Planning KO
enhanced_notes:
### Amplify US 2025 Performance & Momentum

- Phenomenal year despite startup-mode challenges
- Successfully transitioned global clients to US clients
- Retained key accounts: Coinbase, Yahoo, Tubi streaming platform
  - Multiple seven-figure projects annually per client
- Major cultural moment wins
  - World Cup and Visa projects
  - Super Bowl participation likely
  - Two projects at Cannes Lions
  - South by Southwest presence

### **1. “What would a *great* year of partnership look like for you in 2026?”**

- Creative studio evolution as biggest priority
  - Moving from freelance-heavy to full-time model
  - Need foundation team to support and coach new hires
  - “Teaching and coaching to get folks to do it the Amplify way”
- Jordan (global CD) seconded to NYC for 6 weeks through mid-December
  - Providing teammates opportunity to see excellence in action

### **2. “Where do you see the biggest pressure points next year — capacity, capability, or clarity?”**

- Creative studio turnover challenges
  - MCT departure created tough team transition
  - Rob (3D architect from RE) lasted 7-8 months
  - Greatest turnover on smallest team creates significant impact
- Production vs creative hiring dynamics
  - Production: easier to identify talent, broader backgrounds work
  - Creative: taste and cultural fit more critical, harder transitions

### **3. “If you could choose: what do you want UNKNOWN to take off your plate next year?”**

- Immediate hiring needs for H1 2026


- **2D Designers** (2 roles)
  - Junior: $120K (January start)
  - Midweight/Senior: $140-160K
- **3D Designers & Architect** (2 roles)
  - Both midweight level: $150-180K
  - Zero 3D designers currently on team
  - Zero architects currently on team
- **Group Creative Directors** (2 roles)
  - $180-220K range
  - Michael Yu freelancing until end February (Michi replacement)
  - Second role: either convert Nikki or hire new (May start)


- Total hiring investment: \~$900K-$1M in salaries
- “Conservative number” - could increase with continued growth

### **4. “How do we make the partnership more proactive than reactive?”**

- Current freelance approach comparison
  - Working with Brooklyn-based production recruiter
  - $12K monthly retainer model with placement guarantees
  - Structured process: speed dates, second rounds, completion deadlines
- Desired creative freelance bench
  - 5-10 pre-vetted people per discipline
  - Regular availability checks vs constant sourcing
  - Repeat relationships with trusted talent

### **5. “What level of agility and protection do you want built into next year’s model?”**

- Budget planning clarity needed for January-June period
- Preference for flat fee structures over percentage-based
  - Easier project profitability calculations
  - Keeps recruitment costs in overhead vs project line items
- Partnership contract clarity
  - One-year expiration on introductions
  - Need structure around freelancer transitions to permanent

### Commercial Structure Discussion

- Current Unknown pricing: 18% placement fees
- Proposed project fee approach
  - $45-50K upfront for all six roles
  - $117K completion fees across placements
  - Potential fee reduction for volume commitment
- Alternative models explored
  - Bench model: $15-20K upfront, reduced ongoing rates
  - Embedded consultancy: dedicated hours, Slack integration
  - Similar to Midnight Club, Raw Materials, Buttermilk partnerships

### Candidate Pipeline Updates

- Lav from Droga5 meeting Ed tomorrow
  - Currently considering $200K CD role at Droga5 (Meta account)
  - Wants account diversity vs 3+ years on Meta
  - Could start immediately if Amplify role materializes
- Nikki performing well on current project
  - Working TV projects with Jessica’s support
  - Good cultural fit, potential permanent conversion candidate

### Next Steps

- **Sam**: Prepare PDF with structured partnership options by next Tuesday
- **Jessica**: Brief Jevon on partnership planning discussion
- **Both**: Next meeting scheduled Tuesday December 3rd, 10am PST
- **Ed**: Meeting Lav (Droga5 CD candidate) tomorrow while on vacation

---

Chat with meeting transcript: [https://notes.granola.ai/t/29615b90-e172-424e-bd60-fc7397c761a4](https://notes.granola.ai/t/29615b90-e172-424e-bd60-fc7397c761a4)
my_notes:
## **1. “What would a _great_ year of partnership look like for you in 2026?”**

This reveals her expectations, ambitions, frustrations — and opens the door for you to structure a model around them.

## **2. “Where do you see the biggest pressure points next year — capacity, capability, or clarity?”**

This lets you cleanly introduce:

- **Bench** = capacity
- **Search** = capability
- **Transform/Consultancy** = clarity
- **Projects** = tactical surges

## **3. “If you could choose: what do you want UNKNOWN to take off your plate next year?”**

This gives you permission to map them to your “three front doors” without sounding sales-y.

It also makes her realise: You’re not a supplier. You’re relief.

## **4. “How do we make the partnership more proactive than reactive?”**

This is the perfect question to position:

- Bench = pre-emptive coverage
- Search = planned leadership moments
- Consultancy (Transform) = removing future friction
- Project fees = flex around peaks

## **5. “What level of agility and protection do you want built into next year’s model?”**

- Speed
- Predictability
- Budget certainty
- Dedicated resource
- Or more strategic involvement

From there, the commercial conversation becomes _easy_ — because you’re solving for what she just said.

THE BENCH:

**“The Bench is an always-on pool of pre-vetted freelancers who already feel like part of Amplify — giving you instant capacity without the chaos of sourcing every time.”**

“We build and manage a curated freelance squad around your needs, so whenever demand spikes, you’ve got trusted people ready to drop straight in.

JESS: 

Phenominal business…. global

retained the business they had before. 

Coinbase, Tubi, Yahoo, Lego, 

Winning the worldcup, visa. At the superbowl, SXSW, big moments. Two projects at Cannes. 

Team… the biggest side was to evolve was creatives. 

identify what they’re hiring for. 

HIRES:

Biggest challenge is still there… need to hire 4-5 roles. 

H1 asap. 

3D - midweight

Architect - midweight

2D designer - midweight

Creative Directors - Michael Yu, just started. Michi - Giant Spoon. 

Value on introduction. End of Feb. replacement role for Michi. 

Group CD role. 

Jan and June. 

2 × 2D’s. (Jr $120K, 140-160K)

2 × 3D’s (archietect) ($150-180K)

2 CD’s ($180-$220K)

- Michaels role that opens in Feb.
- Either Nicky or someone else.

something creative togehter. 

$117K on completion.

Dedicated to Amplify. 

They’re 10am PST. 

240

300

360

introduction point of view. 

Budgeting perspective. 

Jan to June…. 

More structure. 

Mark, Zoe, 

3 month period at $3K per month. 12k per month. 

retainer model for full-time searches. 

5-10 within each discipline. 

Search for the big hires, 

Bench for elasticity, 

Consultancy for structure,

Project fees for one-off spikes.
